data.text:
Marton Csokas is an actor who has appeared in numerous films, plays and television series. He is a New Zealand actor who is also making waves in Hollywood. Among the numerous films he has acted in is his role in the Blockbuster trilogy; The Lord of the Rings propelled him into the mainstream of the American film industry. Often he plays the role of a sympathetic man or a cruel strongman.

Marton Csokas – Bio

The New Zealand actor was born on June 30, 1996 in Invercargill, New Zealand with the middle name Paul. He is the son of the Hungarian mechanical engineer Marton Csokas and the nurse Margaret Christine. Marton is of mixed ethnicity as his mother, being of Danish, English and Irish descent and Australian while his father is Hungarian. The actor has dual citizenship – Hungarian and New Zealand. Csokas has a younger brother named Robert.

Creativity once existed in his immediate family; his father launched his career as a trapeze artist in his prime and was also unique with his voice as an opera singer. Unfortunately, he didn’t feed that career enough before he ran away as an engineer. As a child, Marton Csokas observed his father closely and learned his father’s trade.

Marton Csokas earned a bachelor’s degree in art from Canterbury University in New Zealand and attended Kings College as an undergraduate student. Graduated in 1989 by Toi Whakaari.

Career – Movies and TV Show

Marton Csokas made his first appearance on the set of the New Zealand drama series. shark in the park . He then made a cameo appearance in an episode of Technical KO and for two consecutive years he starred as Leonard Rossi-Dodds on Shortland Street . In 1996 he made a stunning appearance in the film, Broken English . From 1997 to 2001, Csokas was a recurring cast in the drama series. Xena: warrior princess.
